title: How to Make White Bean Salad with Tomato Salsa

steps.headline: Rinse the coriander.
steps.description: Take the coriander sprigs and rinse them well under a cold tap. Give them a good shake and set aside.

steps.headline: Rinse and drain the beans.
steps.description: Place the beans into a colander. Rinse them well under a cold tap and leave them to drain in the colander.

steps.headline: Dry and chop the coriander.
steps.description: Place the coriander sprigs on some kitchen paper. Place another piece on top and pat dry very gently so as not to bruise the herb. Now use a small knife to chop it very finely.

steps.headline: Core and chop tomatoes.
steps.description: Remove the core out of the tomatoes and slice them into very small pieces.

steps.headline: Chop the chilli (chili).
steps.description: Chop the chilli into little rings and then chop them again, very finely.

steps.headline: Chop the spring onion (scallions).
steps.description: Next, halve the bulb, and slice and dice it very finely. Slice the stalk and chop it all together into very small pieces.

steps.headline: Prepare the lime juice.
steps.description: Cut the lime in half and pierce it with a fork, twisting the fork round, squeezing out the juice into a small bowl.

steps.headline: Combine the salsa ingredients.
steps.description: In a bowl, add the tomatoes, coriander, chilli, onions, and finally lime juice. Mix together thoroughly. Season with some salt and pepper and stir again until the ingredients are all well combined.

steps.headline: Dress the beans.
steps.description: Transfer the beans into a large bowl. Dress them with the olive oil, salt, and pepper. Take the spatula and mix together thoroughly.

steps.headline: Serve the bean salad.
steps.description: Using the spatula, scoop some beans into a serving bowl. Heap a generous serving of the salsa on top and enjoy!

text: Rinse the coriander. Take the coriander sprigs and rinse them well under a cold tap. Give them a good shake and set aside. Rinse and drain the beans. Place the beans into a colander. Rinse them well under a cold tap and leave them to drain in the colander. Dry and chop the coriander. Place the coriander sprigs on some kitchen paper. Place another piece on top and pat dry very gently so as not to bruise the herb. Now use a small knife to chop it very finely. Core and chop tomatoes. Remove the core out of the tomatoes and slice them into very small pieces. Chop the chilli (chili). Chop the chilli into little rings and then chop them again, very finely. Chop the spring onion (scallions). Next, halve the bulb, and slice and dice it very finely. Slice the stalk and chop it all together into very small pieces. Prepare the lime juice. Cut the lime in half and pierce it with a fork, twisting the fork round, squeezing out the juice into a small bowl. Combine the salsa ingredients. In a bowl, add the tomatoes, coriander, chilli, onions, and finally lime juice. Mix together thoroughly. Season with some salt and pepper and stir again until the ingredients are all well combined. Dress the beans. Transfer the beans into a large bowl. Dress them with the olive oil, salt, and pepper. Take the spatula and mix together thoroughly. Serve the bean salad. Using the spatula, scoop some beans into a serving bowl. Heap a generous serving of the salsa on top and enjoy!
